p: Our interest focused on the study of complex mixtures that contain a remarkable fraction of flowers, whatever their primary use was. These involve “ zhourat” in Syria and Lebanon, “ sarantha” in different parts of Greece and “ karteraki” in Crete (Greece), “tea of flowers” and “ osmanlı çayı, Ottoman tea” in Turkey, and “ demonush”, “ dammnusch” or “ dammnous” in Iran. We also included the industrial versions of these when available.
